sentences.en: "You won't get away with this," he said with unexpected bravado.
sentences.cn: “这事你休想就这么过去，”他以出人意料的强横语气说道。

sentences.en: All day long, wearing a mask of false bravado.
sentences.cn: 白天, 我总带著虚伪夸张的面具.

sentences.en: As a footnote, I should add that there was one point on which his bravado was more than justified.
sentences.cn: 我补充一句，他有时表现得过分逞强。

sentences.en: He behaved aggressively out of bravado.
sentences.cn: 他摆出一副挑衅的架势,但只是虚张声势.

sentences.en: He flourished the weapon in an attempt at bravado.
Her little bravado made her feel as if she ought to make amends.
sentences.cn: 她这样闹了一下之后,觉得自己似乎应该作些补偿.

sentences.en: His bravado carried him too far and prejudiced his case.
sentences.cn: 他过分的虚张声势给他的诉讼带来了影响.
他那种英雄气概全然不见了.

sentences.en: Take no notice of his threats they're sheer bravado.
sentences.cn: 别理会他的威胁 -- 完全是虚张声势.

sentences.en: The promise to build a new district is no mere bureaucratic bravado.
sentences.cn: 建设新城区的承诺不仅仅是官僚式的虚张声势.

sentences.en: The soldiers cloaked their fear with joking and bravado.
sentences.cn: 士兵们藉开玩笑和夸口来掩饰其恐惧.

sentences.en: Their behaviour was just sheer bravado.
sentences.cn: 他们的行为完全是虚张声势.

sentences.en: We strove to prevent our courage from turning into bravado.
sentences.cn: 努力预防我们的勇气变成一种虚张声势.

sentences.en: What he lacks in courage he compensates for in bravado.
sentences.cn: 他用虚张声势来弥补自己勇气的匮乏.

trans.tran_cn: 虚张声势，故作勇敢，冒险
trans.tran_en: behaviour that is deliberately intended to make other people believe you are brave and confident
